title: What we can all learn about sleep from a long-haul pilot
text:
To reach your exotic holiday location, you need to suffer the grime and ennui of a long-haul flight. Not only is there boredom and bad food, there is (for most, except the lucky or the medicated) sleeplessness, and a confusing romp through several timezones. And for the longest flights, to Australia and New Zealand, an overnight stop in an anonymous airport hotel somewhere in the Far East.

But the latter could soon be a thing of the past, thanks to the Australian airline Qantas. On Oct 20th, a Boeing 787 completed a 19 hour, 10,000 mile journey between New York and Sydney, without the need for a stop. This was a test flight with only 49 people on board: the next trial will be from London to Sydney,...
description: To reach your exotic holiday location, you need to suffer the grime and ennui of a long-haul flight.
